feed.title: Hard fork proposal from last week's meeting

entry.title: Hard fork proposal from last week's meeting
entry.summary: The context is a PGP-signed message with a conversation between Jared Lee Richardson and an unknown individual. The conversation centers around the idea that if typical personal computers cannot run nodes, there is no security. Jared argues that if an attack is not possible when personal computers can't run nodes, then this logic has no place in the discussion. The conversation ends with the statement, "Governments are good at cutting off the heads of a centrally controlled networks."
